xxl.core.util
Class DoubleArrays

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.util.DoubleArrays

public class DoubleArrays
extends java.lang.Object

Static methods for dealing with double[] as numerical vectors.

mult

public static double[] mult(double[] d1,
                            double[] d2)
Computes the product of the two given double[] componentwise. Example: (( 3, 2, 1)' * ( 1, 2 ,3)' = ( 3, 4, 3)' ) Both double[] need to be of the same length

Parameters:
d1 - double[] to multiplicate componentwise
d2 - double[] to multiplicate componentwise
Returns:
The componentwise multiplicated double[]

mult

public static double[] mult(int[] i,
                            double[] d)
Computes the product of a given int[] and a given double[] componentwise. Example: (( 3, 2, 1)' * ( 1.1, 2.1 ,3.1)' = ( 3.3, 4.2, 3.1)' ) Both arrays had to be of the same length.

Parameters:
i - int[] to multiplicate componentwise
d - double[] to multiplicate componentwise
Returns:
The componentwise multiplicated double[]

divide

public static double[] divide(double[] dividend,
                              int[] divisor)
Computes the inverse product of a given double[] to a given int[] componentwise. Example: (( 3.3, 2.5, 5.5)' / ( 3, 1 , 2)' = ( 1.0, 2.5, 2.25)' ) Both arrays have to be of the same length.

Parameters:
dividend - double[]
divisor - int[]
Returns:
The componentwise divided double[]

equiGrid

public static double[] equiGrid(double start,
                                double end,
                                int n)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns a grid of equidistant points between two given borders containing n values (start and end values inclusivly)

Parameters:
start - left-handed border of the grid
end - right-handed border of the grid
n - number of grid points
Returns:
a double[] containing grid points as a = x_0 < x_1 < ... < x_(n-1) = b with |x_i - x_(i-1)| = c for i=1, ... , n-1
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if lower border is not bigger as an upper one or the number of grid points is to small

realGrid

public static java.util.Iterator realGrid(double[] start,
                                          double[] end,
                                          int[] resolution)
Returns a sequence of n-dim data points.

Parameters:
start - starting vector
end - ending vector (exclusivly)
resolution - number of computed values for each dimension
Returns:
a iterator containing Objects of type double[] representing the counter objects.

realGrid

public static java.util.Iterator realGrid(double[] start,
                                          double[] end,
                                          int resolution)
Returns a sequence of n-dim data points.

Parameters:
start - starting vector
end - ending vector (exclusivly)
resolution - number of computed values for each dimension (using the same for each dimension)
Returns:
a iterator containing Objects of type double[] representing the counter objects.
